Grant Information.grantNumber:Grant Agency: Women and Children's Health Research Institute (WCHRI); Stollery Children's Hospital Foundation

citation:Description.dsDescription:Text: The CHAPTER III Study is a cluster randomized controlled trial evaluating the impact of a nurse-led transition intervention in combination with usual care, versus usual care alone, on preparing adolescents with congenital heart disease (CHD) to successfully transition from pediatric to adult cardiology care. The investigators propose to conduct a nurse-led intervention that addresses the educational needs of 13-14 year old adolescents.

Related Datasets: Evaluation of Novel Transition Interventions for Youth with Congenital Heart Disease (CHAPTER I)
The CHAPTER II Study - Congenital Heart Adolescents Participating in Transition Evaluation Research
ore:describes.Title: The CHAPTER III Study of Young Adolescents: Congenital Heart Adolescents Participating in Transition Evaluation Research
ore:describes.socialscience:Actions to Minimize Losses: Non-responders will receive a phone reminder two and four weeks after each questionnaire.
ore:describes.socialscience:Collection Mode: Self-administered questionnaire: Paper; Self-administered questionnaire: Web-based; Self-administered writings and/or diaries; Observation; Chart review
ore:describes.socialscience:Sampling Procedure: The target number of study participants is 60.
ore:describes.Subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
ore:describes.socialscience:Universe: 13 and 14 year old adolescents with moderate or complex congenital heart disease (CHD).
ore:describes.Kind of Data: Questionnaire data; Clinical data; Qualitative data
ore:describes.Data Sources: Transition Readiness Assessment Questionnaire (TRAQ); MyHeart Scale
ore:describes.socialscience:Frequency: Questionnaire data will be collected at baseline,1 month, and 6-month post enrollment. Chart review will occur at baseline. Qualitative data will be collected at the time of sessions (nursing logs) and 1 week after session (text and emails).
ore:describes.socialscience:Control Operations: Field validations are built into REDCap data collection forms.
ore:describes.Alternative Title: The CHAPTER III Study of Young Adolescents
ore:describes.socialscience:Characteristics of Data Co: Adolescents in the intervention group will take part in a one-on-one session about health-related decision-making, self-advocacy, and lifestyle issues provided by a nurse.  Sessions be youth-oriented, interactive, and engaging. This session will be held in conjunction with a scheduled pediatric cardiology clinic visit and. They will be encouraged to contact the RN at a study email address or by text messaging with follow-up questions. Adolescents in the control group will received standard of care. They will see a nurse only to measure weight, height, and blood pressure and relied on their cardiologist for information about their heart condition.    Youth will complete the MyHeart Scale and the TRANSITION-Q Questionnaire in the clinic area at enrollment for the 'usual care' group, and prior to intervention for the 'intervention' group. Both groups will repeat the questionnaires 1 month and 6 months post enrollment.    Medical charts will be reviewed only for information about participants' heart condition, such as date of birth, CHD diagnosis, names and dates of cardiac surgical procedures and cardiac catheterizations, current use of cardiac medications (Y/N), history of missed appointments (Y/N), and cardiologist's name. As well, nursing logs and texts and emails between nurses and study participants will be collected and analysed.
ore:describes.schema:name: The CHAPTER III Study of Young Adolescents: Congenital Heart Adolescents Participating in Transition Evaluation Research
ore:describes.dvcore:conditions: Access to deidentified data may be permitted for external researchers, with limitations. The data producer determines access on a case-by-case basis. Contact the data producer directly to discuss terms and conditions of access.

dvcore:fileTermsOfAccess.dvcore:availabilityStatus: Data is not available because the study is still recruiting.

ore:describes.schema:includedInDataCatalog: Women and Children's Health Research Institute (WCHRI)
